description: Rotate walls. Application with the point keyword may also modify the center of rotation. Rotations follow the right-hand rule where the rotation axis in 2D is toward the viewer. Rotations are not allowed that rotate the wall outside of the model domain. Should any facet conveyor velocities be nonzero, they will be rotated as well. Should the orientation tracking be active, then the orientation is updated by default, though this can be disabled (see the update-orientation keyword).

keywords.name: axis
keywords.description: Axis of rotation as vector (3D only)

keywords.name: angle
keywords.description: Angle of rotation in degrees. Follows right-hand rule

keywords.name: point
keywords.description: Rotation point. If specified, rotation occurs about this point and center of rotation is also rotated. If not specified, rotation occurs about each wall's center of rotation

keywords.name: update-orientation
keywords.description: Explicitly set orientation update status. Used when orientation tracking is enabled. Default: true (orientation updated)

important_notes: Rotations follow right-hand rule (in 2D, rotation axis is toward viewer)
Rotations are NOT allowed that move wall outside model domain
If facet conveyor velocities are nonzero, they are rotated as well
If orientation tracking is active, orientation is updated by default
Center of rotation is also rotated if 'point' keyword is used

examples.description: Rotate all walls 90° around x-axis at origin (3D)

examples.command: wall rotate axis (0,0,1) angle 45 range id 1
examples.description: Rotate wall ID 1 by 45° around z-axis about its center of rotation (3D)

examples.command: wall rotate axis (0,1,0) angle 30 point (5,0,0) range name 'container'
examples.description: Rotate walls named 'container' 30° around y-axis at point (5,0,0) (3D)

examples.command: wall rotate axis (0,0,1) angle 180 update-orientation false
examples.description: Rotate all walls 180° around z-axis without updating orientation tracking (3D)
Rotate all walls 45° (2D - rotation axis toward viewer)

examples.command: wall rotate axis (1,0,0) angle 90 point (0,0,0) range group 'gear'
examples.description: Rotate walls in group 'gear' 90° around x-axis at origin (3D)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('wall rotate ...') - Python SDK does not provide wall rotation functionality
